job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
We are seeking a Software Engineer who will be responsible for developing and maintaining one of our community-supported products. You will have the exciting challenge of designing and building robust and scalable software using a cutting-edge technology stack as we seek to unlock the value of our music data and modernize our products and user experience. The role works as part of an Engineering team and assists this team with estimation and prioritization of development efforts, participating in architectural planning discussions. Our engineers tackle highly complex technical challenges in collaboration with our product and design teams to solve for a variety of problems ranging in complexity and scope. Our engineers have an opportunity to make significant impacts to our architecture and product features as well as our performance and scalability.
Need to Have

Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university in math\computer science related field, or equivalent work experience.
Extensive experience working with production systems; troubleshooting, performance tuning, optimizing, refactoring, etc.
Extensive experience with Python and MySQL
Deep understanding of Software Engineering processes such as version control, build and configuration management, automated deployments, automated testing, etc.
Nice to Have

Knowledge of Javascript, React and eCommerce applications would be a plus.
Possess knowledge of the functions, operation, and mission of the business.
Comfort working in an agile software development process that is highly agile and iterative.
Ability to operate by Discogs principles of:
Results driven: Relentlessly pursue our goals and honor our commitments
Communication: Ask questions, share observations, state facts
Adaptability: Embrace failure through experiential learning, move forward
Impact: Contribute to the story of Discogs' success
